19514:
I never count on yesterday
Because the past can also change
I'll never give myself away
Life is worthwhile on the edge
Words sound so hollow in the cold
Maybe she's forgotten all
I don't remember how
I felt the night she came
Memories spin around
They flow
Don't want to let her down
Moments disappear like shame... like snow
Signs never told me anything
...

...and the waves sighed helpless
as the shore devoured them
the clouds which adorned the sky

so dark but beatyful
every stone, every stem
is all part of a picture
together they weave on the beholder

...

Love is all I feel, and the fear
that it could end one day.
you're the only sense, of my life
and of my pains.

you, you carry my dreams in you,
with your lovely kisses and your tenderness.

why did you left me my all-inundated warmth:
...

I am the only one
who understands me
in my ebony dreams
why can't I be just like them
...happy

life is gone
beautiful, suffering
my eyes drown, in delusion

my body paled and cold, let the
silence bloom I never will arise
...

Broken love fills every part
of my body to late
we've found the knifes in our hearts
let me out, let me out
from a cage called love
so called love?

I would die for you
but now I die for my depression
I haven't no longer to live
because I lost the key to the door of
your lovely mind
the blooming harmony is dispersed
but myself is dispersed too

I feel like a fallen leave
withered in a lost love

...

...and kissed the fairytale-land with pride
under the trees of lust
the leaves pure shadows on me
which shelter me from the darkness
which I was
I hold the dreams, within my arms
thrash the earth, within my tears
...

Tomorrow you will live, to-morrow thou shalt say (Postumus) always. Tell me, tomorrow of yours (you really) when I came? How far away that tomorrow? Where is it? Or why ask? ...
Zeersetz in pale litch which Werme was ...
...and there is no sun
not then and never again
gloss nativity
desirable perfume of light
flavourless silence
the beauty of the gist
...

Still drunken of spring's shining meadows and the myriads of flowers,
we shut our eyes to the beauty and fell asleep
...and oblivion erased our memories of fall and blinded our eyes.
Overwhelming were the days, as autumn embraced
the land of zephyr kissed the sky with passion...
...

...and than she became older and left her friend in admiration
studded with bitter tears sickening falls the colour
taste for taste drowning in the nectar of clouds
which pass the light blind and bleeding
...

It's nothing
...

...What have we done
o. to leave
fail... was I...
more to cover me
o. one
o. tear
...

Heal my sins
I can't bleed more for you
but you mustn't shed more tears for
our fall, to suffer in
...

...So embrace the flowers of fall
and remember the rain
...

Tears are in you
for me my...
somehow restless
annoying
peacefully, to all
...

...And so we take the gift of crying
and bask in the fire of past
the grandeous hope undying
the wish will fall at last
...So this is the sweetest choice
unhearing gate unhearing breath
embrace the stigma of the voice
...

Left, on me
but tears are a part of you
hooked, what is it
all is coming
taste it, to be foolish
...

Fall, and come back to
your only adorned wish
my final soul, for your sun
sometimes we
bask in the
...

o. what harm to be inbalanced
to fall down, this is the only real part
